duties_responsibilities.duty: Coordinate, monitor, and maintain critical elements of the Environment of Care/Life Safety program to ensure regulatory compliance and a safe environment for patients, staff, and visitors across all OGHS facilities.
Identify and recommend strategies to ensure compliance with The Joint Commission, Federal, State, Local codes/regulations related to Environment of Care/Life Safety standards.
Assist with Emergency Management and Disaster Preparedness programs across the health system.
Perform inspections and assessments necessary to maintain a safe environment such as environmental tours, hazardous materials & waste audits, and Environment of Care tracers, etc.
Participate in the development and update of EOC/Life Safety Policies to maintain compliance with appropriate accreditation and regulatory requirements.
Perform Preventative Maintenance checks on select Fire/Life Safety equipment, as assigned.
Coordinate and conduct Fire Drills across the health system while maintaining required documentation.
Accompany outside agency representatives/vendors during fire & life safety inspections, hazardous materials and environmental inspections, and/or accreditation & licensure surveys.
Assist with emergency preparedness planning and response when needed.
Maintain all data and documentation related to the EOC/Life Safety program at OGH.
Ensure that the appropriate Environment of Care program managers report findings, recommendations, actions taken, and results of measurements to the OGHS Environment of Care Committee.
Take a proactive approach in identifying EOC/Life Safety hazards and work with the Plant Operations Manager to develop mitigation strategies and monitor mitigation implementation outcomes.
Perform other related work as required or requested in support of the Safety Department and EOC/Life Safety programs as assigned by the Plant Operations Manager.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Healthcare, Business or Engineering/Fire Science preferred. Associates degree in Healthcare, Business or Engineering/Fire Science required.
